description.narrative: By 2022, the Government has increased its capacity to reactivate the specialized system for the comprehensive protection of children and adolescents, with a gender and intercultural perspective and the capacity to respond to emergencies.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, the Government has increased its capacity to reactivate the specialized system for the comprehensive protection of children and adolescents, with a gender and intercultural perspective and the capacity to respond to emergencies.

description.narrative: Ecuador´s child protection system lost specificity and specialty after the constitutional reform of 2008, changing the child protection system to a wider one. After the last CRC report, government of Ecuador is aware of the need to recover a specialized system for children, thus UNICEF CO is providing technical assistance to the National Assembly (Congress) in a process of legislative reforms to the Organic Law for Children and Adolescents (CONA by its Spanish acronym). UNICEF CO is also providing technical assistance to local governments to strengthen the Local Protection Boards, responsible for ensuring child protection at local government | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of communities that count with mechanisms to prevent violence against children and adolescent at the community level.

target.value: 2022:Systematization of the implementation of childhood and adolescence protection model at community level

actual.value: 2019:The mechanism has not been fully developed. However, six communities at the northern border (Esmeraldas and Carchi) implement actions to strengthen community mechanisms to prevent violence against children.

title.narrative: Number of children, parents and primary caregivers provided with community based mental health and psychosocial support and messaging [COVIDSitRep]

Actors from the judicial sector count with a unified protocol to recognize, refer and attend cases of violence againgst children, and a forensic protocol of specialized listening for victims of sexual violence

baseline.value: An assessment of the attention of cases of violence against children in the judicial system.

target.value: 2022:Systematization of the implementation of the unified protocol to recognize, refer and attend cases of violence against children and adolescents; and of the forensic protocol of specialized listening for victims of sexual violence

actual.value: 2019:Theory of change completed. The design of the procedure began with its socialization with actors part of the 2030 Children's Subcommittee group led by the office Public Defender. Judicial servants are trained on the implementation of the forensic protocol of specialized listening for victims of sex

title.narrative: The legislative, executive (prioritzed institutions) and judicial systems are aware of the importance of a specialized and specific child protection system.

baseline.value: Public institutions are not aware on the needs.

target.value: 2022:3 municipalities implement the new model of a decentralized protection system

actual.value: 2019:Assessment completed. Based on this, a new proposal for legal reform includes a specialized children protection system. A model of strengthening the local protection system began its implementation in two municipalities.
